abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Babai Irrigation
            Engineering Project for Nepal was satisfactory. Both the
            Borrower and the Bank performed most of their duties
            successfully. Most of the primary technical objectives were
            achieved by the target date. Even so, the project did not
            fulfill its operational purpose - to produce a bankable
            Babai irrigation project - due in part to international
            water rights complications. The primary lesson learned from
            this experience is that international water rights issues
            must receive high priority attention by all concerned, the
            Bank, Borrower, and consultants. A strategy should be agreed
            upon for dealing with these issues from the beginning of
            project preparation. If not, the project could be delayed or
            lost entirely and breakdown of understanding could occur
            between the Borrower and the Bank.
